intro: Eriope nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flower eriope, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the spring and summer seasons. Eriope nudiflora is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens, particularly in Mediterranean climates.
